content:
• Tuesday, November 22, 2011

  • Stock index futures are sinking in early evening trade, apparently spooked by a report Belgium...

    Stock index futures are sinking in early evening trade, apparently spooked by a report Belgium is unable to swing its share of the Dexia bailout. Talks are reportedly underway with France to negotiate it taking on a larger portion of the rescue. S&P 500 -1%, DAX -1.1%. Among open markets, Hong Kong -2%, Australia -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 PM | 22 Comments
  • DMND

    More on the death of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) Director Joseph Silveira: CNBC's Herb Greenberg...

    More on the death of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) Director Joseph Silveira: CNBC's Herb Greenberg reports the death was a suicide and that a company spokesman says Silveira had recused himself from the accounting investigation. Shares -13.5% AH, and off more than 50% since the payment irregularity was revealed in early November.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (FMCN +14.7%) saw some volatile price action a day after getting hammered by Muddy...

    Focus Media (FMCN +14.7%) saw some volatile price action a day after getting hammered by Muddy Waters' report (.pdf), but finished up strongly. Shares were boosted not only by Focus Media's response to the report, but by a point-by-point refutation from Wedge Partners. Goldman, however, is putting its Buy rating under review.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) drops 1.8% AH after stating it will discontinue Phase III trials for...

    Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) drops 1.8% AH after stating it will discontinue Phase III trials for evaluating the use of its Revlimid drug to help treat prostate cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • GDI

    Gardner Denver (GDI +3%) posted a gain today in spite of a weak tape after the company increased...

    Gardner Denver (GDI +3%) posted a gain today in spite of a weak tape after the company increased the size of its stock buyback plan by 1.3 million shares, or about $100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNV

    Gold royalty play Franco-Nevada (FNV +6%) rose today after reporting (.pdf) Q3 revenue of...

    Gold royalty play Franco-Nevada (FNV +6%) rose today after reporting (.pdf) Q3 revenue of $113.3M (+106% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.35, and maintaining its guidance for 2011 revenue of $375M-$400M. However, shares have fallen 2.4% AH on account of the company announcing it's selling 8M shares to BMO Capital for proceeds of C$340M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • MAR

    Starwood Hotels (HOT -4.7%) took a hit today after Smith Travel Research reported revenue per...

    Starwood Hotels (HOT -4.7%) took a hit today after Smith Travel Research reported revenue per available room fell last month in Europe, where the company has more exposure than its rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • TIVO

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q3 EPS of -$0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $65M (+25.4% Y/Y) beats by $14M....

    TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO): Q3 EPS of -$0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $65M (+25.4% Y/Y) beats by $14M. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • P

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): FQ3 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $75M (+99% Y/Y) beats by...

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): FQ3 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $75M (+99% Y/Y) beats by $3.6M. Claims it had 4.3% share of U.S. radio listening, up from 3.6% in FQ2. Company expects FQ4 revenue of $80M-$84M vs. $82.3M consensus. Expects EPS of -$0.04 to -$0.02 vs. -$0.02 consensus. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • XCRA

    LTX-Credence (LTXC -6.8%) tumbles after its FQ1 results provide more evidence of the ugly demand...

    LTX-Credence (LTXC -6.8%) tumbles after its FQ1 results provide more evidence of the ugly demand environment facing chip equipment makers: revenue of $33.7M (-46% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.08 missed by $3.3M and $0.01. For seasonally weak FQ2, the company expects revenue of $26M-$30M and EPS of -$0.15 to -$0.20, below Street estimates of $35.6M and -$0.07.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • AAL

    Shares AMR Corp. (AMR -5.7%) drop after a U.S. District Court dismisses all existing antitrust...

    Shares AMR Corp. (AMR -5.7%) drop after a U.S. District Court dismisses all existing antitrust claims the company had filed against Travelport and Orbitz Worldwide (OWW +1.4%). American had originally filed the suit contending that the travel companies were illegally conspiring with each other to prevent competition from its own stand-alone proprietary system.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • SCHS

    Shares of School Specialty (SCHS) continue to tank, now down -28.5% after lowering estimates...

    Shares of School Specialty (SCHS) continue to tank, now down -28.5% after lowering estimates earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (PWRD -14.9%) falls to levels not seen since March '09 after reporting Q3 revenue...

    Perfect World (PWRD -14.9%) falls to levels not seen since March '09 after reporting Q3 revenue of $111.2M (+22% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.53, missing consensus by $0.7M and $0.14. Revenue was dinged by a drop in in-game promotions, while margins were hurt by higher advertising and R&D spending. Perfect World expects Q4 Y/Y revenue growth of 18%-26%, below a 29.9% consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • ATV

    Media and branding company Acorn International (ATV +4.5%) rallies after its Q3 results beat...

    Media and branding company Acorn International (ATV +4.5%) rallies after its Q3 results beat estimates on strong performance from its direct sales unit. Net revenue increase 18% Y/Y as top line growth was boosted by a 520 basis point increase in gross margin to 42.0% from 36.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • DLTR

    Dollar Tree (DLTR +2.1%) says it's entered into an agreement with Wells Fargo Bank to repurchase...

    Dollar Tree (DLTR +2.1%) says it's entered into an agreement with Wells Fargo Bank to repurchase $300M of its common shares in an accelerated share buyback as part of its existing repurchase program announced in early October.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • STP

    Solar panel manufacturers get an added boost after Suntech Power Holdings (STP +16.5%) says in...

    Solar panel manufacturers get an added boost after Suntech Power Holdings (STP +16.5%) says in its conference call that business in Germany is picking up, and many of its German customers are bullish going into 2012: JA Solar (JASO +2.6%), Canadian Solar (CSIQ +10.9%), LDK Solar (LDK +5.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Greencrest Capital Management's A.B. Mendez says (video) the decline in Groupon (GRPN -8.6%)...

    Greencrest Capital Management's A.B. Mendez says (video) the decline in Groupon (GRPN -8.6%) today can be traced back to a counterreaction from last Friday's heavy GRPN buying - possibly tied to ETFs or indices loading up. As for rival LivingSocial's dalliance with floating shares - Mendez predicts the firm stays private until it increases subscribers and revenue but will continue to raise cash strategically with the spotlight on daily deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -13.4%) makes new 52-week lows after receiving unenthusiastic notes from...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -13.4%) makes new 52-week lows after receiving unenthusiastic notes from Morgan Stanley (Underweight) and Goldman (Neutral). The former is worried about a soft telco capex environment, and believes breakeven 2012 free cash flow is unlikely; the latter thinks Alcatel "could face liquidity pressures by 2013," should macro conditions remain weak. (Q3 results) (CEO issues)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (YUM +2.9%) trades higher after announcing plans to reorganize its international...

    Yum Brands (YUM +2.9%) trades higher after announcing plans to reorganize its international division, naming Micky Pant chief executive and separating its India business into its own stand-alone segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -2.7%) gets a boost after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a Hold and a...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -2.7%) gets a boost after Wunderlich initiates the shares with a Hold and a price target of $30. Wunderlich says the company is targeting to sell 20,000 cars per year at an average sales price north of $50,000 as it attempts to leverage itself into a crowded market.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • DAL

    Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.3%) gets a lift after Raymond James initiates coverage with an...

    Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.3%) gets a lift after Raymond James initiates coverage with an Outperform. The firm notes that despite the airline's leveraged balance sheet, corporate and non-ticket revenue growth and capacity discipline will improve earnings momentum and profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • AN

    AutoNation (AN +2.4%) gets a boost from a Goldman upgrade to Neutral from Sell on valuation with...

    AutoNation (AN +2.4%) gets a boost from a Goldman upgrade to Neutral from Sell on valuation with a price target of $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • GCO

    Genesco (GCO +3.7%) moves up after its Q3 results beat estimates this morning, driven by...

    Genesco (GCO +3.7%) moves up after its Q3 results beat estimates this morning, driven by acquisitions and strong same-store sales growth. The company reported an EPS of $1.21, better than Street estimates of $0.96, on revenue of $616M versus the consensus estimate of $586M. The company also raises its FY11 guidance to $3.64 - $3.69 per share, up from its previously increased August forecast of $3.35 - $3.42.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • GILD

    Bank of America weighs in on Gilead's (GILD +6.3%) acquisition of Pharmasset with an upgrade to...

    Bank of America weighs in on Gilead's (GILD +6.3%) acquisition of Pharmasset with an upgrade to Buy on valuation. The bank says that following the purchase, the net present value on Gilead's future HCV program could be worth $15B - $30B across a range of scenarios.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM

  • The DJIA erases a 100 point loss, now off 0.2% following the IMF announcement. The Nasdaq gets...

    The DJIA erases a 100 point loss, now off 0.2% following the IMF announcement. The Nasdaq gets back to flat. The euro moves up a bit, +0.3% and buying $1.3526.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • LEN

    Lennar (LEN -2.6%) dips after announcing plans to sell $300M in convertible senior notes due in...

    Lennar (LEN -2.6%) dips after announcing plans to sell $300M in convertible senior notes due in 2021.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SHW

    Valspar (VAL +8.5%) pops after its FQ4 EPS easily beats estimates absent a one-time impairment...

    Valspar (VAL +8.5%) pops after its FQ4 EPS easily beats estimates absent a one-time impairment charge. Strong sales across all lines helped to boost revenue 19% Y/Y, which helped to offset deteriorating margins due to higher input costs and ongoing sluggishness in the U.S. housing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +5.9%) trades higher after investors further digest the ramifications of...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +5.9%) trades higher after investors further digest the ramifications of its mega-acquisition of Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -0.1%) that sent shares skittishly lower yesterday. Citi took a look at the deal, deciding to upgrade GILD to Buy from Neutral, seeing a potential for the now-bigger company to dominate the Hepatitis C treatment market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • PDCO

    Shares of Dental and veterinary wholesaler Patterson Companies (PDCO -2.46%) are weak this...

    Shares of Dental and veterinary wholesaler Patterson Companies (PDCO -2.46%) are weak this morning after its FQ2 earnings missed estimates across the board. Profit fell 8.3% Y/Y as lower dental-supply sales continue to hinder revenue growth. The company also lowered the high end of its FY12 guidance, now projecting its EPS to be around $1.90 - $1.97 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • SCHS

    Shares of School Specialty (SCHS -17.1%) nosedive after the firm lowers its estimate for 2012...

    Shares of School Specialty (SCHS -17.1%) nosedive after the firm lowers its estimate for 2012 revenue to $730M-$740M, from prior guidance of $755M-$780M. CEO David Vander Zanden blames a 3% YTD revenue decline on unit pricing pressure and reductions in funding for student agendas.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • SMP

    Standard Motor Products (SMP -3.9%) trades down after Goldman cuts the stock to Sell from...

    Standard Motor Products (SMP -3.9%) trades down after Goldman cuts the stock to Sell from Neutral on valuation, saying the shares have risen substantially since reporting its Q3 results and further upside will be difficult to sustain. The firm also anticipates slower growth in the replacement parts market in 2012 due to a slower rate of vehicle aging.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.9%) continues trading lower after proposing $400M in bond/stock sales, and...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.9%) continues trading lower after proposing $400M in bond/stock sales, and warning of a 2012 loss. Morgan Stanley expects shares to remain "volatile and range-bound" until more clarity is provided on the ROI Netflix will achieve from its investments, while Morgan Keegan is worried about the potential for additional downside risk to Q4 subscriber estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • EV

    Eaton Vance (EV -3.3%) dips after its FQ4 earnings fell 6.9% Y/Y on lower fee revenue amid a...

    Eaton Vance (EV -3.3%) dips after its FQ4 earnings fell 6.9% Y/Y on lower fee revenue amid a turbulent market. On Thursday Eaton Vance said that October assets under management had declined Q/Q to $188B from $199B. Net outflows were $2.73B, compared with net inflows of $3.16B a year earlier and $ 1.86B a quarter earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • PSS

    Shares of Collective Brands (PSS -11.1%) fall sharply after the firm misfires with its Q3 report...

    Shares of Collective Brands (PSS -11.1%) fall sharply after the firm misfires with its Q3 report - announcing revenue of $894M vs. a consensus estimate of $908M. CEO Michael Massey says the firm has learned from the weak performance of its Payless unit and is in the process of implementing "pricing actions" that will improve sales. The company plans to accelerate its store closings in 2011 to 350 from 315.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +3%) gains on a Needham upgrade to Buy on valuation. Needham says recent channel...

    Nvidia (NVDA +3%) gains on a Needham upgrade to Buy on valuation. Needham says recent channel checks are showing Tegra 3 to be gaining traction in next-gen phones for 2012. As a result of the increase its raising its Tegra forecast by $80M for FY13.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -3.4%) remains lower following its FQ4 report; bulls are trumpeting H-P's enterprise...

    H-P (HPQ -3.4%) remains lower following its FQ4 report; bulls are trumpeting H-P's enterprise opportunities and low valuation, while bears are downbeat on near-term issues and management's credibility. Arik Hesseldahl sees Meg Whitman's CC remarks about H-P halting its M&A binge as a mixed blessing, given its "uncertain organic growth;" it's worth noting 2010 acquisition 3PAR had another quarter of 100%+ growth. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -7.4%) continues its sharp post-IPO slide, hitting a new low of $21.76 - within...

    Groupon (GRPN -7.4%) continues its sharp post-IPO slide, hitting a new low of $21.76 - within sight of its $20 offering price. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 3 Comments
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy (CQP -2.4%) signs a 20-year contract to sell liquid natural gas to...

    Cheniere Energy (CQP -2.4%) signs a 20-year contract to sell liquid natural gas to power-generation giant Gas Natural Fenosa, as part of its effort to build the first liquid natural gas export terminal in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • AN

    AutoNation (AN +2.6%) gets a boost with an upgrade from Goldman Sachs on a valuation call....

    AutoNation (AN +2.6%) gets a boost with an upgrade from Goldman Sachs on a valuation call. Shares have fallen off 12% over the last month, while showing a high level of interest from shorts.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • STP

    Suntech Power (STP +3.1%), which fell 2 weeks ago after preannouncing its Q3 results, is...

    Suntech Power (STP +3.1%), which fell 2 weeks ago after preannouncing its Q3 results, is rallying after reporting them, dismal though they are. Revenue of $809.8M (+9% Y/Y) beat by $32.9M, but EPS of -$0.64 missed by $0.38. In addition, Suntech expects Q4 solar shipments to drop 20% Q/Q from Q3 levels, and its gross margin for the quarter to come in at 9%-11%, below Q3's 13.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • CHS

    Shares of Chico's FAS (CHS -11.1%) move sharply lower after its Q3 report misses consensus...

    Shares of Chico's FAS (CHS -11.1%) move sharply lower after its Q3 report misses consensus estimates for top-line and bottom-line results. Improved sales couldn't offset increased discounting and higher expenses at the women' specialty retailer. The company announced a new $200M share repurchasement plan to replace its existing plan that had $24M remaining on it.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • FRO

    The implosion of shares of Frontline (FRO -42%) following reports of increasing cash problems at...

    The implosion of shares of Frontline (FRO -42%) following reports of increasing cash problems at the company casts a dark cloud over the sector - pressuring the shares of rivals lower on similar financial and tanker rate worries: FRO -14.7%, GNK -4.1%, PRGN -4.6%, DRYS -3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -9.2%) sells off after pricing a previously-announced follow-on offering at...

    Fusion-io (FIO -9.2%) sells off after pricing a previously-announced follow-on offering at $33/share. Fusion-io is issuing 3M new shares as part of the offering, while existing shareholders are selling 5.8M-7.1M shares. The company's IPO lockup begins to expire on Dec. 6, though a full expiration doesn't occur until mid-February.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • OMX

    OfficeMax (OMX +5.9%) trades higher after announcing it will close 20 stores and downsize...

    OfficeMax (OMX +5.9%) trades higher after announcing it will close 20 stores and downsize existing stores. The company also says it will hold off on adding new stores for the time being.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • HRL

    Shares of Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL) tack on a 1.4% gain after the firm beat the consensus EPS...

    Shares of Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL) tack on a 1.4% gain after the firm beat the consensus EPS estimate of analysts by a penny on revenue of $2.1B (+2% Y/Y). The company expects 2012 EPS to fall in a range of $1.79-$1.89.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel (NASDAQ:CBRL), which raised its FQ1 guidance 2 weeks ago, is down 0.7% after...

    Cracker Barrel (NASDAQ:CBRL), which raised its FQ1 guidance 2 weeks ago, is down 0.7% after reporting earnings. Revenue of $598.4M (flat Y/Y) and EPS of $1.03 missed by $3.9M and $0.02. Comparable restaurant sales fell 1.6% Y/Y, and comparable retail sales fell 1.3%. The company expects FY12 revenue of $2.55B-$2.6B and EPS of $4.10-$4.25, compared with a consensus of $2.55B and $4.21.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • BRCD

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) is up 6% after beating FQ4 estimates, and guiding (.pdf - see page 27) for...

    Brocade (NASDAQ:BRCD) is up 6% after beating FQ4 estimates, and guiding (.pdf - see page 27) for FQ1 revenue of $530M-$550M and EPS of $0.12-$0.14, compared with a consensus of $535.3M and $0.11. Though Brocade's storage switch revenue fell 4% Y/Y, partly due to competition from CSCO's FCoE switches, it rose 10% Q/Q, better than expected. In addition, Brocade saw 14% Q/Q growth in Ethernet switch sales. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) says it will acquire privately owned XLHealth for an undisclosed amount...

    UnitedHealth (NYSE:UNH) says it will acquire privately owned XLHealth for an undisclosed amount to help add to its Medicare business. XLHealth claims 113K Medicare Advantage members from six states and estimates revenue will exceed $2B in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • LNG

    Premarket gainers: LNG +11%. BRCD +6%. FMCN +4%.Losers: FRO -39%. FIO -11%. JASO -9%. ALU -8%....

    Premarket gainers: LNG +11%. BRCD +6%. FMCN +4%.
    Losers: FRO -39%. FIO -11%. JASO -9%. ALU -8%. PSS -8%. NFLX -6%. LYG -5%. STM -4%. NOK -4%. DB -4%. BBVA -3%. NBG -3%. ING -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM

  • Stock index futures give up moderate gains and turn red following the weak print on revised Q3...

    Stock index futures give up moderate gains and turn red following the weak print on revised Q3 GDP (reminder: we're more than halfway through Q4). S&P 500 -0.3%, Nasdaq 100 -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • NTR

    Shares of Potash (POT) gain 1.1% in premarket trading after the company is named by Morgan...

    Shares of Potash (POT) gain 1.1% in premarket trading after the company is named by Morgan Stanley as one of its preferred stocks. In a note to clients, analysts say the USDA is "materially underestimating" corn-related feed demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • FMCN

    As expected, Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) has responded to Muddy Waters' bearish report (.pdf),...

    As expected, Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) has responded to Muddy Waters' bearish report (.pdf), which accuses the company of multiple types of fraud, by strongly denying each allegation. It remains to be seen whether Focus Media will brush off Muddy Waters' attack like Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD), or validate it like Sino-Forest, but for now, shares are up 14.5% premarket, rebounding a bit from yesterday's crash.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • CRZBY

    Commerzbank (OTCPK:CRZBY) shares tumble 8.5% in Frankfurt after the lender says it will need...

    Commerzbank (OTCPK:CRZBY) shares tumble 8.5% in Frankfurt after the lender says it will need about €5B to fulfill new EU capital requirements. Deutsche Bank (NYSE:DB) slides in tandem, -2%. The steep midday drop has snuffed - for the moment - most of a solid rally in the DAX, currently up +0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM
  • HPQ

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is down 1.2% post-earnings (I, II); FQ4 results beat estimates, but FY12 guidance...

    H-P (NYSE:HPQ) is down 1.2% post-earnings (I, II); FQ4 results beat estimates, but FY12 guidance was soft. Weakness in high-margin areas such as printing supplies (-14% Y/Y) and high-end servers (-23%, thanks to ORCL's abandoning of Itanium) are weighing on EPS. Moreover, CC comments about "competitive pricing" and cost increases, to go with expected remarks about macro uncertainty, might be troubling investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO) shares collapse in Oslo as the world's largest operator of oil tankers,...

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO) shares collapse in Oslo as the world's largest operator of oil tankers, worried it will run out of cash next year, pursues talks with lenders. Down 60% since 2010's start, tanker rates have been in unprofitable territory for nearly all of 2011. Frontline is trying to get in front of other shippers that will likely need restructuring in 2012. Shares -42% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 1 Comment

  • European stocks rally in early trading after heavy losses yesterday, brushing off the...

    European stocks rally in early trading after heavy losses yesterday, brushing off the Congressional supercommittee's inability to come to a debt deal. Euro STOXX 50 +0.6%, London +0.6%, Paris +0.8%, Frankfurt +0.8%, Milan +0.7%, Madrid +0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 AM | 1 Comment
